note.p: Committee appointments include: Committee for improving the English language (1664)
Acted as a legal adviser to the Society, e.g. on the authorisation of the Society's Charter and its statutes (1663).
Involved in experiments with lead and quicksilver (1661).
'The Peover Papers and Wales', in the 'Transactions of the Honourable Society of Cymmrodorion', 1960, p.82

Notes: The election date is Ellis' re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected on 14 August 1661 and admitted into the Society on 21 August 1661.
Hunter gives death date as 1672. He may be the Ellis who was Vicar of East Walton, Norfolk (1626-1673).
